alert.note: Alert for Grant; Jefferson; Lonoke; Pulaski (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 1:10PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Prairie, Lonoke, east central Grant, northwestern Jefferson and southeastern Pulaski Counties through 145 PM CDT... At 110 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Scott to near Hensley Island to 6 miles southeast of Sheridan. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... North Little Rock... Pine Bluff... Lonoke... White Hall... England... Carlisle... Redfield... Altheimer... Humnoke... Keo... Barrettsville... Estes... Meto... Toltec Mounds State Park... McCreanor... Hensley Island... Brummitt... Prairie Center... Pine Bluff Arsenal... Parkers Corner... This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 161 and 190. Interstate 530 between mile markers 18 and 41, and between mile markers 45 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for central and southeastern Arkansas.
